Award.AwardTitle: 2016 Biomedical Engineering Society (BMES)-National Science Foundation (NSF) Special Session

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration: NSF has made an award in support of a "BMES-NSF Special Session on Research in BME and Grant Writing" outside the regular program of the Annual Meeting of the Biomedical Engineering Society (BMES) being held in Minneapolis, MN, October 5-8, 2016. The funding will be used to promote, convene and record the session and offset travel costs and registration fees for NSF awardees (5) and reviewers (2) who will serve as presenters, panelists, and potential mentors/collaborators for novice and emerging investigators participating in the session. The 3 hour session, featuring presentations showcasing NSF funded research and researchers (2 CAREER awardees and 1 non-CAREER awardee), a Networking Reception, a Tutorial on Essential Elements to Develop a Successful NSF BME Grant, and an Interactive Grant Writing and Submission Panel Discussion, will be held on October 7, 2016. The recorded session will be posted on the BMES website for on demand viewing. These special sessions, which began in 2013, contribute to a comprehensive approach by BMES, whose annual meeting serves as the premier conference for the Biomedical Engineering community, in partnership with NSF to ensure development of a diverse, well educated, and technically competent biomedical engineering workforce.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 2016 Biomedical Engineering Society (BMES) Annual Meeting was held in Minneapolis, Minnesota, from October 5-8, 2016. During the meeting and in partnership with the National Science Foundation (NSF), BMES convened the fourth “BMES-NSF Special Session on Research in BME and Grant Writing” on October 7, 2016. The special session focused on promoting and sustaining innovative research in biomedical engineering and essential elements to developing a successful NSF biomedical engineering grant proposal. The session has recurred annually at the Annual Meeting from 2013-2016 to support the BMES and NSF shared goals to develop a diverse, educated, and technically competent biomedical engineering workforce.

NSF funds were used to promote, convene and record the session and defray the costs for NSF awardees and reviewers to serve as presenters, panelists, mentors, and collaborators for novice and emerging investigators participating in the session. The session included two (2) proposal presentations from NSF CAREER grantees in different stages of their CAREER awards and one (1) proposal presentation from an NSF unsolicited grantee, a Tutorial on Essential Elements on Developing a Successful Proposal, an Interactive Grant Writing and Submission Panel Discussion with five (5) panelists, to include NSF program directors, awardees and reviewers, and ended with a Networking Reception.

The session drew a crowd of standing-room only with over 100 participants in attendance. The BMES Annual Meeting was an ideal venue for the BMES-NSF Special Session because it stimulated conversations and networking among over 100 BME faculty and aspiring faculty. The session enabled broad participation of aspiring BME faculty to gain an increased awareness of NSF-sponsored proposals, attain a better understanding of NSF funding opportunities and how to prepare successful BME grant proposals, and offered participants a place to build new relationships and foster future collaborations.
